question: Question_02_(a)_iv
sols:
We first reduce the right hand side using Euler's Formula (or Fermat's
Little Theorem). As $\displaystyle \gcd(3,17) = 1$ and

$\displaystyle 3^{\phi(17)} \equiv 3^{17-1} \equiv 3^{16} \equiv 1 \mod{17}$

and hence

\begin{align*}
3^{162} &\equiv 3^{160}\cdot 3^{2} \equiv 9 \mod{17}
\end{align*}

Now, we have

$\displaystyle 9x \equiv 9 \mod{17}$

and thus, multiplying both sides by the inverse of 9 gives

$\displaystyle x \equiv 1 \mod{17}$

(notice that we didn't need to compute this inverse, though if we wanted
to the inverse is 2).
